intro: Magnolia biondii var. latitepala, commonly known as the Chinese magnolia or the broad-leaf magnolia, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its large, showy white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. The leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture and a glossy green upper surface. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a pyramidal shape when young and a more irregular form as it matures. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
